result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquel Antonio Clements

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquel Antonio Clements in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Marquel Antonio Clements.  Attorney James Griffin in court on behalf of Attorney Gerald Henry Alder for State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense informs the court of another pending matter 22CF4048.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquel Antonio Clements appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Marquel Antonio Clements.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #19CF4674. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Domine. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marquel Antonio Clements in court by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Due to trial issues Attorney Plaisted is not available for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders balance to be returned to the person posted.   
  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marquel Antonio Clements in court with Attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
